result.execSummary:
The defendant Hailee J. Wegerer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hailee J. Wegerer

defendant.name: Wegerer, Hailee J.

records.addlTxt: Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with elements

9:30 PM cases 20CF1072, 21CF1379, 22CF046, 22CF326, 20CF1353 called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hailee J. Wegerer in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Hailee J. Wegerer. Defense recites the joint agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court has colloquy with the defendant regarding her rights and her counsel. 
In 22CF326: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 of the Information (Count 3 of the Criminal Complaint). 
In 21CF1379: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3 of the criminal complaint. 
In 22CF46: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3 of the criminal complaint. 
In 20CF1072: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 of the criminal complaint. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
As to the misdemeanors to which the defendant pled, court orders defendant to pay court costs and applicable surcharges and provide a DNA sample. 
As to Count 1 in 20CF1072: Court withholds sentence and places defendant on Probation for 5 years with conditions: 
120 days in Jail, all Stayed pending further order of the Court. Huber to be determined if Stay on the jail is lifted. 
No Contact with K.M.P.
No Contact with co defendant J.G. without permission from the probation agent. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to complete Anger Management and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant has 52 days sentence credit if revoked from Probation.
Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:33 PM cases 20CF1072, 20CF1353, 21CF1379, 22CF46, 22CF326 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hailee J. Wegerer not in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Hailee J. Wegerer. Defense advises the defendant called his client and spoke with her- she does not have transportation to the courthouse for today's hearing. State is not opposed to resetting today's hearing since she is in contact with her attorney. Defendant must appear in person for the next hearing which is to be re-scheduled with the branch 1 judicial assistant.
Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

8:30 AM cases 20CF1072, 22CF46, 20CF1353, 21CF1379, 22CF326  called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hailee J. Wegerer in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Hailee J. Wegerer. Defense requests a new date. 
All files scheduled for 5/12/22 at 3:30 PM (ARGN in 22CF326, all others STC).

3:07 PM Cases called: 20CF1072, 20CF1353, 21CF1379 & 22CF46. Defendant Hailee J. Wegerer appeared in court, Attorney Karl A Schmidt for Hailee J. Wegerer appeared in court, Attorney Tiffany M. Winter for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Warrant is quashed. State is not opposed to a cash bond. Defense would like signature bond to continue. Court orders bond to continue in all files. 

22CF46 and 21CF1379 Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas on both files. Court accepts pleas. STC: 04/29/22 at 8:30am
Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant on March 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:32 AM Cases called: 20CF1072, 20CF1353, 21CF1379 & 22CF46. Defendant Hailee J. Wegerer not in court, Attorney Karl A Schmidt for Hailee J. Wegerer appeared in court, Attorney Tiffany M. Winter for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Attorney Schmidt does not have any information on his client. State requests a warrant due to history of non appearances. Court orders a warrant in all cases. Defendant will need to appear in person in front of Br. 1 to quash warrant.
Status conference on March 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Same as Complaint.

1:30pm Cases called: 20CF1072, 20CF1353, 21CF1379 & 22CF46. Defendant Hailee J. Wegerer appeared in court, Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared in court for Hailee J. Wegerer, Attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 21CF1379 & 22CF46 and Court accepts waiver. All cases are referred to Br. 1 for scheduling a status conference.
